question: When you hear the sirens or see the red emergency lights of a closely approaching emergency vehicle, you must:
b: Drive slowly until it has passed
c: Drive to the right edge and stop
d: Stop in the intersection
answer: Drive to the right edge and stop

question: If a pedestrian is in a crosswalk in the middle of a block:
b: The pedestrian must yield the right-of-way
c: Vehicles have the right-of-way, but drivers must legally take care for the pedestrian safety
d: Drivers must honk the horn approaching the crosswalk, to urge the pedestrian to cross faster
answer: The pedestrian has the right-of-way

question: On a two way highway, you are allowed to drive on the left half of the roadway when
a: There is a double yellow center line
b: There is a solid line on your side of the center line
c: It is safe to pass, and passing is allowed
d: You are approaching a corner at which you intend to turn left
answer: It is safe to pass, and passing is allowed

question: The car behind you begins to pass you. You should:
a: Maintain your speed so traffic will flow smoothly
b: Pull to the right and stop so he can pass
c: Slow down slightly and stay in your lane
d: Blow your horn to allow him to pass
answer: Slow down slightly and stay in your lane

question: Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
b: Have trouble driving slow
c: Are better drivers because they are not hungry
d: Have trouble controlling their vehicles
answer: Have trouble controlling their vehicles

question: When a traffic signal light is not working, you should:
a: Stop only if other vehicles are present
b: Slow down and stop if necessary
c: Stop and then continue driving when it is safe
d: Proceed through the intersection as usual
answer: Stop and then continue driving when it is safe

question: If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
a: Change lanes and maintain your current speed
b: Be prepared for workers and equipment ahead
c: Slow down because the lane ends ahead
d: Speed up to avoid rubbernecking
answer: Be prepared for workers and equipment ahead

question: When may you legally drive around or under a railroad crossing gate?
b: When you can clearly see in both directions
c: When the gate does not seem to be working correctly
d: When you think you can drive through before it comes down
answer: Under no circumstances

question: When roads are slippery, you should:
a: Decrease the distance you look ahead of your vehicle
b: Stop and test the traction of your tires while going up hills
c: Avoid making fast turns and fast stops
d: Refrain from driving at all costs
answer: Avoid making fast turns and fast stops

question: What are the colors of a sign which tells you the distance to the next exit of a highway?
b: Black with white letters.
c: Red with white letters.
d: Green with white letters.
answer: Green with white letters.

question: On the intersection, if you see a green arrow pointing to the left, you can:
b: Make a protected turn left
c: Make a turn left or go straight
d: Turn left only if there are no vehicles coming in the opposite direction
answer: Make a protected turn left

question: When you drive through an area where children are playing, you should expect them:
a: To know when it is safe to cross
b: To stop at the curb before crossing the street
c: To run our in front of your without looking
d: Not to cross unless they are with an adult
answer: To run our in front of your without looking

question: When parking downhill and the curb is absent, your front wheels must be turned:
b: Parallel to the road
c: Towards the side of the road
d: In the direction of traffic
answer: Towards the side of the road

question: You may drive across a sidewalk to:
a: Avoid driving over a speed bump
b: Enter or exit a driveway or alley
c: Make a U-turn
d: Pass a traffic jam
answer: Enter or exit a driveway or alley

question: If you need to slow down or stop when other drivers may not expect it, you should:
b: Look over your shoulder for traffic in your blind spot
c: Quickly tap your brake pedal a few times
d: Get ready to blow your horn
answer: Quickly tap your brake pedal a few times

question: You may drive off the paved roadway to pass another vehicle:
a: If the shoulder is wide enough to accommodate your vehicle
b: If the vehicle ahead of you is turning left
c: If the vehicle ahead of you is turning right
d: Under no circumstances
answer: Under no circumstances

question: When approaching a railroad crossing with no warning device, the speed limit is:
b: 20 mph
c: 25 mph
d: 30 mph
answer: 15 mph

question: There is a school bus ahead of you in your lane with flashing yellow lights. You should:
a: Stop, then proceed when you think all the children have exited the bus
b: Slow to 25 MPH and pass cautiously
c: Slow down and prepare to stop
d: Stop immediately and wait until the bus goes away
answer: Slow down and prepare to stop

question: You just sold your vehicle. You must notify ______ within 5 days.
b: SJSU
c: Your insuarance provider
d: DMV
answer: DMV

question: Looking down the road to where your vehicle will be in about 10 seconds helps you to ______________.
b: Avoid last minute moves
c: See hazards inside your car
d: Check if there's any hole on the street
answer: Avoid last minute moves
